item.ENTRY: Create Plan Rules As a Copy of Actual or Plan Rules

TLINE.TDLINE: &TITLE&
The following doc describes how you can copy plan rules for internal
orders with this report
&PURPOSE&
The report creates plan rules in a certain target version with
reference.
&INTEGRATION&
In R/3 the system automatically copies plan rules form actual rules
with the first plan settlement. This function and its restrictions are
described in note 207722 - For the planned settlement there are
special settlement rules. Up to and including Release 4.0, one
settlement rule applied to all plan versions. As of Release 4.5 there
is one settlement rule per plan version; that is, you have to maintain
one settlement rule per plan version to be settled. For the automatic
generation of settlement rules there is only one option: If with the
first planned settlement of a version there is no settlement rule for
this version, the system checks whether a planned settlement rule for
this plan version can be generated from the valid actual rule. The
system thus checks, whether a valid actual settlement rule exists with
settlement type PER or VOR (releases prior to Release 4.5 only PER) and
receiver, cost center, business process, order, WBS
element, profitability segment (releases prior to Release 4.5 only cost
center and business process). If there is a rule, it is copied.
Otherwise, the system generates error message KD265.
Negative list:
The following restrictions apply for the automatic generation of the
settlement rule for the first planned settlement of a version:
·,,Actual rules with settlement type GES cannot be copied to PER plan
rules.
·,,Plan rules cannot be copied from other plan versions.
The system does not generate a plan rule if there is already a plan
rule for the affected version which, however, is no longer valid. (This
restriction is removed with Release 4.6C.)
&PREREQUISITES&
The restrictions listed in the negative list above are removed with
this report .
&FEATURES&
The report creates plan rules in a certain target version with
reference.
You can choose, if the reference should be plan rules of a different
version of actual rules. If you choose actual rules, you can choose if
the system should copy PER-rules (flag FUL-rules blanc) or FUL-rules
(flag FUL-rules = X).
The settlement year determines the year for the reference rule, i.e.
it determines in which year the reference should be looked for, i.e.
only rules valid in the settlement year are copied. If a rule exists
in the target version, which is valid for the whole settlement year,
the report does not do anything. Please note that the validity of the
new rule is limited if a plan rule exists in the target version and
this plan rule is valid for part of the validity of the reference rule
&SELECTION&
The selection variant determines the selected objects. Create a
selection variant in transaction KO9G (Plan settlement internal orders)
or CJ9G (Plan settlement projects) if necessary.
&STANDARD_VARIANTS&
&OUTPUT&
&ACTIVITIES&
&EXAMPLE&
Examples for the copy function:
1.,, Copy plan rules from version 000 to version 003 in 2001 without
rule in version 003:
The order may have the following plan rules:
·,,100% PER in version 000 to cost center 4710 valid 1/1998-12/1998
·,,100% PER in version 000 to cost center 4711 valid 1/1999-12/2002
The report results in creating the following rule:
·,,100% PER in version 003 to cost center 4711 valid 1/1999-12/2002
2.,,Copy plan rules from version 000 to version 003 in 2001 with plan
rule in 2000:
The order may have the following plan rules:
·,,100% PER in version 000 to cost center 4711 valid 1/1999-12/2002
·,,100% PER in version 003 to cost center 4712 valid 1/1999-12/1999
The report results in creating the following rule:
·,,100% PER in version 003 to cost center 4711 valid 1/2000-12/2002
3.,,Copy plan rules from version 000 to version 003 in 2001 with plan
rule in 2001:
The order may have the following plan rules:
·,,100% PER in version 000 to cost center 4711 valid 1/1999-12/2002
·,,100% PER in version 003 to cost center 4712 valid 1/1999- 6/2001
The report results in creating the following rule:
·,,100% PER in version 003 to cost center 4711 valid 7/2001-12/2002
4.,,Copy plan rules from version 000 to version 003 in 2001 with plan
rule in 2001:
The order may have the following plan rules:
·,,100% PER in version 000 to cost center 4711 valid 1/1999-12/2002
·,,100% PER in version 003 to cost center 4712 valid 1/1999- 12/2001
The report does not do anything.
